episode_event_specialcos02_ch0108_40_nob:
Before the tea party, Ingo visited Darach to learn
the way of the butler.
You want me to teach you the way of the butler?
Yes, please!

Through Evolution, my partner Accelgor has shed
its shell and reached a new level of nimbleness.

Through this tea party, I, too, want to reach a
new destination.

The frontier of the butler! My goal is to become a
butler who can offer customers the
ultimate service.
I see... I understand now.

However, butlers and Subway Bosses are already
similar jobs in that they both offer hospitality
to others.
I’m afraid I may have nothing to teach you...

Oh, I know! Would you help me with my
work, Ingo?
Help you? With pleasure!

Thank you. The thing is, I’ve been asked to
transport supplies for the tea party.

Those supplies are to be collected on the opposite
side of the island from the tea party venue.

I need to decide which Pokémon would be best
suited to carry a significant amount of
heavy supplies.

There are three means of transportation: land, sea,
and air...

Of the three, which do you think could most
quickly and safely transport the supplies?
Land... Sea... Air...

Well...there aren’t any trains on Pasio, so perhaps
the sky would be better than land.

But I don’t think there are any Flying-type
Pokémon strong enough to carry all the heavy
supplies safely.

It sounds like you have your answer, so let me
restate the question at hand.

What kind of Pokémon would be best suited for 
quickly and safely transporting the supplies?

Bring a team of three sync pairs that match the
“type” of your answer!

The answer is “Water-type”! To carry the supplies
by sea!

You’ve figured out the safest and fastest method
for your client. I’m impressed!
Thank you for your kind words. It is an honor!

If you ever decide to start a dining car service,
I’m sure this experience will come in handy.

I’ve been watching the two of you work from
behind the scenes.

What a lovely job you’ve done! Perhaps you could
also help me tend to my flowers?
I’d like help taking care of the children, too!
Please, my work is still far from perfect...

Ingo, you originally served as a Subway Boss.
You know from experience how to treat
customers properly.

You already possess the most important attribute
of a butler: a heart filled with hospitality.
Such words of encouragement!
Perhaps you, Emmet, and myself...
could create a team of butlers!
